titleInfo.title: Brown County Bluegrass Festival - Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys - 1968-11-10 - part 1

mods.accessCondition: This audio file is the property of the Country Music Hall of Fame® and Museum and may be protected by U.S. and international copyright laws. The file may not be downloaded, reproduced, or distributed without permission. End users must obtain all required permissions or consents from the owners of such rights. To inquire about use permissions and obtain a high-quality version of this, contact audio@countrymusichalloffame.org. Please cite audio file information in email.
mods.abstract: Part one of various performances at the Brown County Jamboree Bluegrass Festival, located in Bean Blossom, Indiana, featuring Bill Monroe (performer) and his Bluegrass Boys, Roland White (guitar), Vic Jordan (banjo), Kenny Baker (fiddle), Jim Monroe (bass), as well as Gordon Terry (performer), Doug Green (performer), Ralph Stanley (performer), and an unidentified performer referred to as Mrs. Walton. Recorded on November 10, 1968.

subject.topic: Bill Monroe and the Bluegrass Boys (Musical group)

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum
